reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is absolute great!

I have been learning to trade the real markets for a few months now but also love a good RPG or RTS game. This game actually models the commodity and stock markets, risk/reward, supply/demand, trading techniques and trading styles. I can play this with little guilt I am not studying the real markets as this is already helping to add meaningful context to an aspiring trader!

Really recommend this, and if you have no idea what trading is but enjoy this game then look at the markets and the potential lifestyle it can give. This is a good stepping stone!
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you feel like handling resource+building+military aspect is an RTS is too much, try this.
This game is experimenting with the concept of a purely resource oriented Fast-Paced Economic RTS.

It is a niche that is not for everyone.
I like it a lot myself as I'm a fan of Anno, Civilization, SimCity and Age of Empires. Think of it as a blend between the three. The only condition I recommend this game in is to someone who might enjoy something so fresh out of the box.

Pros:
+ Great concept. Unlike any other RTS you have played.
+ Good, smooth graphics
+ Immersive environment
+ Four factions that allow variety and replayability; Expansive (all about resources), Scientific (upgrade perks), Robotic (no food required), and Scavenging (frugal master pirates)
+ Very easy to learn, but hard to master

Cons:
- Campaign has no story, its interface very clunky. Just premade skirmishes.
- Concept can get boring quite quickly.
- The objective (have more money than the enemy) or how you do it (sell lots of stuff) is pretty identical no matter what the map-maker dishes out at you
- The cheap voiceovers were made on a free text-to-speech website are quite annoying and no option to mute voice
- The price-tag is quite rediculous for what it is, and what it does, and the kind of effort or cost that went into making it. Anything over 15 USD is hardly warranted.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really like the concept of this game. In a game market dominated by games that use violence as the main driver of story real time economic stratagy games are rare gems. Video games are quickly becoming the major story telling device of the 21st centry and I would like to see Offword Trading Company embrace this. Please develope this game to teach economic and market principles like short selling, supply and demand, ect. The setting, Mars, also is a great pick. It ties into our cultural obsession with the red planet and our longing for a new frontier.

The game diffently needs some more work and polishing however. For starters the rounds are seem very short and the tutorial is not very good.

The possibilities for expanding the game seem nearly endless. I would like to see some resources and building types added. Some possible resources to add: white metals (gold, silver, platinum), rare earth minerals (lithium and others). Uranium, medicine, and art just to name a few. I would like to see more power options like nuclear reactors added to the building types.

Also more random events might make things interesting things like dust storms.

Update: This game no longer works and has not worked for many weeks. It crashes when you go to start a mission and even after two updates, an upgrade to windows 10 on my machine, and two re-downloads it still crashes. Do not pay for the beta of this game save yourself the money and aggrivation.

Update: After months of this game being offline it is finally fixed.

Edit: UI update ruined this game. It is ugly, extremely difficult to use, and borderline unplayable now. Game had a lot of potential but now I would strongly suggest avoiding it unless they restore functionality.

Very unique and enjoyable. Even though there are probably only about 25 buttons in the entire game, it's very different every time and doesn't get stale quickly. The multiplayer community is alive even in early access. This is not a click spamming game, you don't need  300 APM to play, but it is still an RTS so there are areas where a bit of speed helps. Personally I think about 40 APM is the limit beyond which there is very little difference. On the surface it looks like a number crunching game but you never really need to do math beyond which number is bigger." Games take about 20 minutes start to finish. Considering the graphics
